title: 104_s1486
content: PLACEMENT PROGRAMS FOR FEDERAL EMPLOYEES AFFECTED BY REDUCTION IN FORCE ACTIONS. The "Public Servant Priority Placement Act of 1995" establishes placement programs for Federal employees affected by reduction in force actions. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management must establish a Government-wide program and each agency must establish an agency program to facilitate employment placement for affected employees. The "Public Servant Priority Placement Act of 1995" requires agencies to offer vacant positions to employees affected by reduction in force actions, as long as the position is within one grade of their current role, has a similar pay rate, and is in a reasonable commuting area. The Government-wide placement program established under the "Public Servant Priority Placement Act of 1995" coordinates with agency programs for employee placement after a reduction in force. It requires offering vacant positions to well-qualified employees from other agencies within the commuting area of their residence or last held position. The agency placement program offers well-qualified employees vacant positions within the commuting area of their residence or last held position, as long as the classification and pay of the offered position match their current or previous role. This program does not impact existing priority placement programs within the Department of Defense. The agency placement program does not affect existing priority placement programs within the Department of Defense. Technical and conforming amendments are made to section 3329, renaming it as "Government-wide list of vacant positions." The agency placement program does not impact existing priority placement programs within the Department of Defense. Section 3329 is renamed as "Government-wide list of vacant positions."
